name: correlation_ts_loop
label: Correlate ts loop
description: Computes the correlations between timeseries selected by observed contexts. The observed contexts are defined by the ContextIdent parameter. Example of context: a travel by car.

inputs.name: dataset name
inputs.label: DSname
inputs.description: The dataset on which correlation is computed

parameters.name: corr_method
parameters.label: Method
parameters.description: The method computing the correlation between 2 timeseries. Choose Pearson to apply the pearson correlation.

parameters.name: context_name
parameters.label: Group by
parameters.description: Name of the metadata identifying each observed context, where correlations are computed. For example: timeseries captured from a car, could be observed during a specific travel - the observed context.

outputs.name: result
outputs.label: Result
outputs.description: Result including the correlation matrix. If there are more than one context: the matrix items are aggregated by Mean. Also provided: matrix of links to each computed correlation result.
